content: Your thread title should read "conscience," not "conscious." Aside from that, what law/regulation/guideline are you referring to? I know of nothing that FORCES anyone to perform any medical procedure against his/her conscience or religious beliefs. The closest I can come to an exception is to cite the requirement for pharmacists to dispense legally-prescribed medications (such as birth-control pills or Plan B - aka "morning after pills") as prescribed ... and even then, if there is another pharmacy within reasonable distance, the patient can be referred there. It's only when isolated that exceptions may not be granted.

content: In general I agree with you, although I would expect the health care provider to allow the patient to find an alternate provider without obstacle. I think it is unacceptable when a doctor or pharmacist (a) refuses to provide a service and (b) actively works to obstruct the patient from receiving that service. This has happened frequently where the pharmacist has refused to dispense birth control but has also refused to return the prescription so that it could be filled elsewhere. If someone had a situation where the moral opinions of the provider were in conflict with the urgent medical needs of the patient, that could also cause a problem, but I am personally unaware of any such circumstances. If the only doctor in a 100 miles refuses to perform your abortion, it is up to you to go 200 miles to the one who will.

content: quote: If a doctor does not want to preform abortions he should not work at a facilitiy that offers that procedure. That seems pretty clear cut since the vast majority of abortions are performed by abortion clinics ... but that isn't really the issue here. The issue is whether qualified doctors that work at facilities that do not perform abortions except under the most specific of conditions (life threat to the mother for example) or not at all should be compelled to perform them. The general use of "doctors" is also a bit misleading ... relatively speaking, few doctors are qualified to perform abortions.
